title: Charlottesville 'Very Fine People' Statement
summary: After white nationalist 'Unite the Right' rally where Heather Heyer was killed by white supremacist driving car into counter-protesters, Trump said 'you had some very fine people, on both sides.' Widely condemned for creating moral equivalence between white supremacists and counter-protesters. Multiple Republicans criticized; resignations from advisory councils followed.
keyFacts: White nationalist 'Unite the Right' rally in Charlottesville, Virginia
Counter-protester Heather Heyer killed when car drove into crowd by white supremacist
Trump (August 15): 'You had some very bad people in that group, but you also had people that were very fine people, on both sides'
Also stated: 'I'm not talking about the neo-Nazis and the white nationalists; they should be condemned totally'
Widely condemned for creating moral equivalence between white supremacists and counter-protesters
Resignations from White House advisory councils followed

sources.text: CNN and Washington Post coverage, August 2017
